name: BEST WESTERN Cranbrook Hotel

reviews.title: Good stay
reviews.text: Checked in after 9 hrs on the road. The hotel gave me a discount rate. They extended that rate to the couple we were traveling with.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean hotel, didn't eat at the restaurant on site.
reviews.title: Expensive Best Western

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Big new hotel in convenient area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a 10 day bike trip thru the States and Canada staying at a new hotel almost every night, the Best Western chain got at least 90% of our business....this was by far the most expensive hotel...especially considering a complimentary breakfast was not included with our stay.
reviews.title: very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came to Cranbrook for a night to see Corb Lund. The room was really comfortable, the AC worked and the staff was highly attentive. The room was a but pricey but well worth it considering it is a long weekend. Shower pressure is decent. Didn't partake in breakfast as the bistro was not open at it's scheduled time. Hotel is situated on the main highway, easy to spot. If you have a CAA/AMA card, use it. Overall a nice stay, stay here every time I visit Cranbrook.
reviews.title: Comfortable night's sleep

reviews.text: This is a very comfortable hotel. The rooms are laid out well, the beds are comfortable, and the staff are very friendly. It also has all the amenities that are worthwhile: it has a pool and fitness centre. The parking is open and clean. It is easy to navigate and is relatively close to most amenities. It is not in the downtown core but it is a quick drive or nice walk downtown, if you have the time.
reviews.title: Nice Rooms, Comfortable Setting, and Friendly Staff

reviews.text: This property was near my work site. I appreciated the fact that the property was near the downtown and near the work site. Staff was great and the room was roomy and nice. I did year the train a few times but nothing too overpowering.
reviews.title: In town for business, was a nice relaxing place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fairly new hotel in Cranbrook . Good location for exploring Kootenay Region of BC .Close to most shopping and restaurants . ie WalMart , Superstore No real panache but a solid choice for an overnight stay.
reviews.title: Basic but Best in Area

reviews.text: Spent one night here in March 2013 for business. Front desk staff was quick and polite on check in, and the room was a good size, clean and well appointed.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Extremely disappointed and insulted by the highly over-priced accomodation. I have stayed in the Cranbrook region for many years and it isn't exactly a resort destination respecially in January! The hotel has a very attractive outside appearance with service that does not match. They dress up the reception staff like an expensive hotel brand and the minute you leave the lobby reality takes over. The card keys for the room took about 10-15 trys each time I tried to enter my room (which even though the hotel appeared empty my room was at the back of the hotel (about 1-2 blocks away!). The bathroom supplies minimal and mid-quality at best. The Wi-Fi was terrible and very spotty on every occasion I tried to use it (probably not helped by being sent to the back of the hotel!?). The train noise (especially at the back is extremely noisy and you better bring ear-plugs if you expect to sleep. The restaurant was an absolute insult! The cook tells you that it only opens if someone shows up at this time of year, I tried to order off the really limited menu for breakfast and they had nothing ("too slow to keep food fresh")! $159 + taxes ($179 total) and because I booked through Air Canada they could not give me any type of receipt so I could not submit any receipt for business use!
reviews.title: Over-priced

reviews.text: Recently stayed here with a hockey team. The property was perfect for our purpose. Nice size suite to host parents for drinks each night. Rooms were clean and appointed as expected. Service was good. No restaurant for breakfast on site.
reviews.title: Good family property

reviews.text: Very nice new hotel located on the main street in Cranbrook. Several resturaunts close by.
reviews.title: BEST WESTERN CRANBROOK
Great stay
reviews.text: Helpful staff. On the downside I was disappointed that there was no early morning buffet as that is what I came to expect from BW. Instead they have a bistro that doesn't open till 7:00am. Most business people are long on there way by then . I also think that at $159 a night the price will put occasional travellers off.

We booked this last minute after a long day of driving from Banff. Kind of pricey but we didn't have much choice. This is a brand new hotel right on the main drag in Cranbrook. Room was nice and beds were comfortable. There is a pool with a big waterside that my kids loved. Kind of disappointed that there was no free breakfast since every other Best Western we have stayed at includes a continental breakfast. They also have a coin-op washer/dryer for guest use which was convenient!
reviews.title: No free breakfast but otherwise great!

reviews.text: Nice decor. Clean, modern rooms. Quiet area, centrally located. Only some rooms have a microwave. The pool area didn't have a hot tub. No continental breakfast. I would stay again, though. Beds were a little soft for my liking, but comfortable.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: We checked in after a long day of driving. The hotel looks nice and the rooms are clean and updated though a bit tight with the amount of furniture they have in there. The price was a bit high and does NOT include breakfast though they have a small place downstairs where you can buy breakfast. We opted to walk down the street to another place to eat. I doubt I'd stay there again mainly due to the higher price.
reviews.title: rooms okay, but pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove around alittle looking at hotels before we picked one in Cranbrook. This hotel looked the best to us, so even though it was $150., we stayed. When I asked for something close to the elevator, the desk clerk upgraded us from a queen suite to a whirlpool suite because the queens weren't near the elevator. She was extremely polite and accommodating.
reviews.title: Pricey, but lovely

reviews.text: Although we didn't use the whirlpool tub, it was nice to have the large space.
reviews.title: Serviceable Rooms, Friendly Cook

description: A combination of superior service and friendly hospitality, this hotel can accommodate the most discerning business or leisure traveller. Guest rooms feature deluxe furnishings, amenities and complimentary high speed internet. For an extended stay, select from 1 or 2 bedroom kitchenette suites. Onsite features include indoor waterslide, fitness centre and café.
